intro: Hieracium subsericeum subsp. adenodontum, commonly known as the腺齿蒲公英, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are usually covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in a single head, typical of the Asteraceae family. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf and flower morphology, as well as its specific geographic distribution.
